called four strike whereof two make bushel corn yearly paid eighteen several tenant whereof eight paid three quarter apiece eight half much viz one quarter two bushel two tenant two quarter one bushel bovat land ought yearly blyth carriage six bushel corn another part profit made service tenant ordering demesne otherwise inquisition taken chappel elleton reg blid thursday feast saint year lord robert de b kyngham steward priory concerning diet day labour bondman elleton appeareth day william de pavely gilbert praepositus reeve sworn said upon oath every bovat oxgang call land bondman elleton ought two day work every week viz one week munday thursday another munday saturday rest h ld two bovats ought four day work diet viz munday tuesday thursday saturday day michaelmas lammas happened festival quit lammas michaelmas another day given week said every bovat ought plow halt acre year plowing freed week one diet day work held bovat ought half acre land trahare sarclare metere cariare harrow clott weed reap carry every freed half day work said likewise every bovat ought trahare harrow one day time wheat another time pea barley every bovat make carriage thrice year blith every time half quarter corn carriage made winter three day summer two day work said held one bovat oxgang land find half cart winter carry wood forrest shirewode held two bovats whole ca freed one diet day work likewise every bovat ought carry half cart hay thorp much gore garnemer likewise ought mow common medows st ple priory likewise every bovat ought two hen cock christmas ten egg easter likewise every freeholder ought find bedripe three time august need two workman freeman evidently sochmen doomsday book ought keep work bedripe well faithfully best skill power call boone day harvest family reader good reader thou hereon lookes g pe h abandon mynde haultye may proved y averde though thou think faultye forget basenesse thy byrthe best condem stauntons may compare thee thou canst therefore better conclude rest ryse leest thou rise fall againe meanes enterprise petigrewe go shew thy self truth lurkes darke supervysores attentyve marke stauntons two chevron fox crest dysneys three flower de li upon fesse lyon passant gardant crest stauntons petygrewe champion cheefe warlike wight stauntons stocke pryme thy sequele must blase petigrewe define though haroldes noble sorte thy arm pende vaine yet somethinge war writte book toumbes shew plaine first sir manger staunton knight wylliam came realme one monarche conquer winne time mauger knight thrughe feat arm sheeld marcyall prowes valeant wanne feelde belveor castle houlde stauntones tour highte strongest forte front hiest men fighte unto forte force flagge stauntons stocke must sticke defende foe could kicke emme worthy fame also son knighted mauger name whiche last syr mauger tooke wife beautrix sage wise valeant father every enterprise whiche lady beautrix daughter lord belveor castle vale tombes armes accorde whiche two sir knight crosslegged lieth male armoure fine theire superscription worne away theire deathes without time yet warlike wightes helmes heades stauntons church lie soules doubt noble anne deathes two son theim betweene anthonie iohn well learned iohn preest weene anthonie noble squire lover poore stout man couragiouse well willinge evermore marride one good worshippe lovde life godlie woman respect name mistris sithe elder robert ragnell nevell forgott father lovd much cause whie good squier nevell liveing great ancient name worthie house whose stocke doth florishe yet anthonie sithe also child two neene vertuouse six wedded well many child bene richard robert iohn wilyam elizabeth anne moe ellen brigit katherin sithe must richard iohn yssue elzabeth truste wed roger north walkringham whalpole anne matchd selfe wilyam snowe whose life shorte reede yet yssue seene iohn richarde indeede ellen next wedde wilyam wilde nettelworth lord yonge man tooke cote brought soe passe ellen wilde bear sonne edwarde doe call onlie heire landes right may fall brigit like woman wise matchd ierome brande lorde westhall stauntons grange understande though life shorte yet child foure robert wilyam also isbell anne beget god send well katherin staunton brigit sister lovinge housebande tooke richard marshall proper man comelie looke sithe sister wedde god lovde amisse earth body hath entoumbd soule remaines blisse anthonie father mean brother theis godlie child builte stauntons chimney stand windowe hall soon laide downe flatte chested stone whose toumbe may discerne lie suche one hic jacet anthonius staunton armiger filius thomae staunton armigeri sitha uxor ejus filia roberti nevell senioris de ragnell armigeri quae ipsa obiit feb qui obiit septimo die februarii anno christi quorum animabus propitietur deus amen anima domino deo meo vivet et semen meum serviet ipsi en dieu maffie robert staunton eldest next anthony heire bludde worthiest theim famouse squire good doinges father life small gaine amounte eight hundred poundes owe accounte yet yeares dischargd without raiseing rente fewe lease likewise make furnishe intente dide order tooke thirtie poundes yeare soone purchased landes fee left theim heire well learnd studiouse bookes writeings shewe deedes note wonderfull prove true built porch stauntons house building faire towardes southe next orcharde remaines heire hic jacet robertus staunton armiger filius haeres anthonii staunton armigeri qui quidem robertus obiit junii wilyam staunton age lord lande mother likewise gave urbis patrem subscribimus statuae hunc urbis genium obiit calend sextilis anno partu virgineo mdclxi materno lx arm monument ermine esse sable three pheons arg edovardus greavesus memorande mihi post nullos smythe ministros quam cito te verbi gladio peccata prementem quam cito te domini recte sacrum verba secantem sava falce sua mors importuna secavit angelicam nisi certus eram te vivere vitam perpetuos tristi resonarem carmine luctus gulielmus smythus obiit pastor de newark mihi greavese satis duris spectate periclis mitte precor gemitus lacrymas effundere mitte nam mihi mors lucrum mihi christus vita perennis corpus hoc tumulo est animam super aethera vexit rex deus omnipotens arx cornu petra piorum det deus astriferum mecum te scandere coelum obiit novemb dom aetatis suae edovardus greausus quondam verbi domini praeco ecclesia novarcensi quoque terra tegit tandem suavissime smithe os sub hoc tumulo recubant super aethera fertur spiritus ut tecum coelesti pace fruatur vtque tibi fuerim sincero junctus amore tam tibi vicinum placuit mihi smithe sepulcrum mi seele vale ne sim tibi causa doloris johannes seelus quis mihi fraena dabit luctus compescere tantos quantos quam chari mors dira ministrat amici si quicquam posset pieta aut gratia vulgi mors nondum greausum prostrasse funere tristi quia stelliferi voluit te rector olympi coelos tolli non restat causa doloris obiit three flower de li monument memoriae sacrum pientissimae conjugis margaretae domini mathaei saunderii shanctoniensis agro leicestrensi equitis aurati filiae quae cum optimis naturae dotibus ex instinctu praedita tum virtutibus parentum cura diligentia que summum quasi ad vestigium aucta quintum vicesimum aetatis annum agens johanni lockeo regiensi sedibus hertfordianis generoso nupta est quo cum ut piissime conjunctissime que suum uxoris per tres annos conjugale munus obiit serum sibi cita suis carnem hic depositura se ad plureis penetravit quarto idus septembris anno verbi incarnati cui officii amoris ergo monumentum hoc maritus ille moestissimus extruxit eja age siste locum tenet hunc matrona sacratum clara venusta pudens religiosa gravis ergo jacent charitas pieta que sed astra vicissim hac poterant alia non reperire via margarita jacet non annis dempta sed anni vt spectes animum dant obiisse senem inscription arm locko saunders impaled viz arg bend two waterbougets sable locko party per chevron sab arg three elephant head erased counterchanged saunders another tomb second wife impaled arm locko gules fesse arg three crescent many escallop azure elli grantham inscription ad memoriam sempiternam janae suae dom thomae elisio de granthamia finibus lincolniensibus equiti aurato unique conciliis domino regi provincia boreali minoris natu filiae morum pariter formae spectabilis venustate sibi que post quadrennium interrupti foelicissimi conjugii paribus auspiciis secundi torus matrimonium collocatae cui ut fere quae sunt cordi maxime vertente biennio nottinghamie accidit humanitus fato praematuro cedere calendis sextilibus annosque jam haud uno viginti amplius habenti ad humanae salutis dc xxxix johannes lockeus hertfordiensis de rigia generosus monumentum hoc desiderii conjunctionis ergo consecravit sanctissimaeque conjugi superstes dissidium luctuosus deflet elysia de gente redux jana sed ebeu cur haec lux quae dat gaudia curta daret ne coelum invidiae quanquam juvenis que vigens que serior optarim viseret umbra polo image chara diem melior ne que munus obivit reddita que elysiis orta que dignatuis another monument p viri apprime venerabilis georgii cote bonarum artium fere omnium thesaurarii principis artis instar omnium theologiae cimeliarchi gregis egregii custodis denique ut ingenii ut vitae cultum instituerint omnibus merito exemplaris cujus pectus pietatis sacrarium fuere cujus lingua spiritus tuba fuere cujus manus christi erogatrix fuere cujus domus religionis schol fuere cujus vita morum consura fuere qui ut annos quatuor viginti summa fide summaque diligentia curam hujus ecclesiae sustinuerat exantlato labore ad patriam rediturus mortale quod erat servandum heic deposuit caetera perennier luctum amicis
